allData.occupation: Winston & Strawn Partner, 7th Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office and 59th leader of the Office since 1802.

positions.title: Partner - DC & SV
positions.description: ONE OF THE NATION’S LEADING PATENT AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY (IP) LITIGATORS AND FEDERAL CIRCUIT ADVOCATES. TECHCRUNCH RECOGNIZED AS ONE OF THE “REMARKABLE WOMEN WHO’VE CONTRIBUTED TO THE AI REVOLUTION,” AND FORBES RECOGNIZED AS ONE OF THE TOP 50 WOMEN IN INNOVATION. ONE OF THE 50 MOST INFLUENTIAL PEOPLE IN THE WORLD IN IP AND A CHIPS HALL OF FAME RECIPIENT.  THE IMMEDIATE PAST UNDER SECRETARY OF COMMERCE FOR IP AND DIRECTOR OF THE U.S. PATENT AND TRADEMARK OFFICE (USPTO), RETURNED TO WINSTON & STRAWN’S WASHINGTON, DC AND SILICON VALLEY OFFICES AND SERVES AS A MEMBER OF THE FIRM’S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

positions.title: Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO
positions.description: Lead one of the largest intellectual property (IP) offices in the world, with more than 13,000 public servants and an annual budget of more than $4 billion. The principal IP advisor to the President and the Administration, through the Secretary of Commerce.  Focused on incentivizing, protecting and bringing to impact U.S. innovation, entrepreneurship, and creativity. Named one of Managing IP’s top 50 most influential people in the world in IP in 2022 and 2023. Recognized in 2024 as one of the “remarkable women who’ve contributed to the AI revolution” and listed in 2024 on Forbes 50 over 50 list: Innovation. Lead an agency whose mission is to help American workers and businesses compete and collaborate, especially in ground-breaking technologies and across all demographics. With a team across the Department of Commerce leading AI and standards policy for the Administration.

positions.title: Vice Chair
positions.description:
Vice Chair of the Council for Inclusive Innovation (CI2) - https://www.uspto.gov/initiatives/equity/ci2.  Led CI2 through the release of the first ever National Inclusive Innovation Strategy -https://www.uspto.gov/sites/default/files/documents/NationalStrategy.pdf.  Launched numerous initiatives including: 
1. First Time Filer Expedited Patent Examination - https://www.uspto.gov/initiatives/first-time-filer-expedited-examination-program?MURL=FirstTimePatentFiler
2. IP Champions - https://www.uspto.gov/initiatives/ci2/ip-champions
3. Diversity Information Platform - https://developer.uspto.gov/diversity-data/home
4. Expanding patent pro bono (free legal services) - https://www.uspto.gov/patents/basics/using-legal-services/pro-bono/patent-pro-bono-program

positions.title: Board Member
positions.description: Unleashing the power of texting and using tech as an equalizer/connector.

positions.title: Silicon Valley Managing Partner, Executive Committee Member, & Patent Litigator
positions.description:
Litigated patent and IP cases.   Represented both plaintiffs and defendants in U.S. district courts, the International Trade Commission, and at the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office. Advised clients—ranging from Fortune 100 companies to start-ups—on their portfolios, patent prosecution, inter partes review, trade secrets, trademarks, and other intellectual property matters. Argued the seminal SAP v. InvestPic case on 35 U.S.C. § 101 (patent eligibility) at the Federal Circuit, and made precedent by obtaining a district court decision reopening case to pierce the corporate veil to seek attorney fees from the lawyers and principals.

Managed the Silicon Valley Office and sat on the Executive Committee.  Founded the Firm's Disruptive Technology Group and Waco Watch.  Sat on the Firm's Diversity and Inclusion Committee.  Founded nextgenlaywers.com.  Avid advocate for diversity, inclusion and equality.

educations.schoolName: State University of New York at Binghamton

allData.headline: Winston & Strawn Partner, 7th Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office and 59th leader of the Office since 1802.
allData.summary: Recognized in 2024 as one of the “remarkable women who’ve contributed to the AI revolution” and listed in 2024 on Forbes 50 over 50 list: Innovation.  Named one of Managing IP’s top 50 most influential people in the world in IP in 2022, 2023 and 2024. Nationally recognized as a top litigator, top IP litigator and top leader. ChIPs Hall of Fame recipient alongside Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Senator Mazie Hirono.
